tweet_text:
𝐂𝐚𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐧𝐡𝐚 𝐞𝐦 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐥 𝐝𝐚 𝐥𝐢𝐛𝐞𝐫𝐭𝐚𝐜̧𝐚̃𝐨 𝐝𝐨 𝐃𝐫 𝐊𝐢𝐳𝐳𝐚 𝐁𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐲𝐞, 𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐨 𝐩𝐨𝐥𝐢́𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐨 𝐧𝐨 𝐔𝐠𝐚𝐧𝐝𝐚.

Recorded in Kampala, Uganda in February 2025, ‘Third Time Lucky’ is a call for Africa’s third liberation sung by Bobi Wine, mixed by Paddyman, and written by Robin Auld and Greg Mills.

The song was released to raise awareness of the rendition and trial by military tribunal of the Ugandan opposition icon, Dr Kizza Besigye. It includes appeals to ‘Free Kizza’ from democrats across the world, including Nobel laureate Oleksandra Matviichuk, former presidents Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, Andrés Pastrana, Martin Torrijos and Ian Khama, former Prime Minister Moeketsi Majoro, the Archbishop of Cape Town Thabo Makgoba, and ministers and opposition leaders from across Africa, Latin America, and Europe.

YouTube:  https:// youtube.com/watch?v=mJN-yB P1uGw … 

X:  https:// x.com/BrenthurstF/st atus/1894004858748878888 … 

Facebook:  https:// facebook.com/watch/?v=93134 5552135807 …  

LinkedIn:  https:// linkedin.com/feed/update/ur n:li:activity:7299771427862269952 …
english_translation:
Campaign for the liberation of Dr Kizza Besigye, political prisoner in Uganda.

Recorded in Kampala, Uganda in February 2025, ‘Third Time Lucky’ is a call for Africa’s third liberation sung by Bobi Wine, mixed by Paddyman, and written by Robin Auld and Greg Mills.

The song was released to raise awareness of the rendition and trial by military tribunal of the Ugandan opposition icon, Dr Kizza Besigye. It includes appeals to ‘Free Kizza’ from democrats across the world, including Nobel laureate Oleksandra Matviichuk, former presidents Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, Andrés Pastrana, Martin Torrijos and Ian Khama, former Prime Minister Moeketsi Majoro, the Archbishop of Cape Town Thabo Makgoba, and ministers and opposition leaders from across Africa, Latin America, and Europe.

tweet_text: É hora de abandonar abordagens autoritárias e adoptar estratégias colaborativas, envolvendo os sectores públicos e privado, a sociedade civil e especialistas em economia. Somente com um diálogo construtivo e uma visão de longo prazo será possível superar a crise e construir uma Angola próspera e sustentável.
english_translation: It's time to abandon authoritarian approaches and adopt collaborative strategies, involving the public and private sectors, civil society, and economic experts. Only with constructive dialogue and a long-term vision will it be possible to overcome the crisis and build a prosperous and sustainable Angola.

tweet_text: Quem realmente combate a corrupção não deveria temer a realização de inquéritos parlamentares sobre o BESA, a Sonangol, o Fundo Soberano e a Dívida Pública. Por que continuam engavetados?
english_translation: Those who truly fight corruption should not fear parliamentary inquiries into BESA, Sonangol, the Sovereign Fund, and Public Debt. Why are they still shelved?

tweet_text: A CAMINHO  DO LESTE DO PAÍS| Ouvindo a voz do povo. Uma sempre renovada fonte de inspiração.
english_translation: ON THE WAY TO THE EAST OF THE COUNTRY | Listening to the voice of the people. An always renewed source of inspiration.

tweet_text: Nos próximos 10 dias, estarei a trabalhar na região leste de Angola. Terra de um povo rico culturalmente e rica também em diamantes, mas imensas violações dos direitos humanos e injustificada pobreza, fruto da má governação. Como pode uma zona tão produtiva continuar abandonada? Está na hora de dar voz ao leste e exigir investimentos que beneficiem as comunidades.
english_translation: For the next 10 days, I will be working in the eastern region of Angola. A land of a culturally rich people and also rich in diamonds, but immense human rights violations and unjustified poverty, a result of bad governance. How can such a productive area remain abandoned? It's time to give a voice to the east and demand investments that benefit the communities.

tweet_text: A caminho do Leste de Angola, a caravana do Presidente Adalberto Costa Júnior efectuou uma paragem na cidade de Malanje para uma breve saudação aos citadinos e militantes.
english_translation: On the way to Eastern Angola, President Adalberto Costa Júnior's caravan made a stop in the city of Malanje for a brief greeting to the citizens and militants.

tweet_text: Ontem iniciamos a nossa jornada de trabalho no leste do país, passando por Xá-Muteba e Cafunfo, na província da Lunda-Norte. Dormimos em Cafunfo, junto do povo, e dialogamos com diversos líderes da sociedade civil. Partilhamos ideias, mas, acima de tudo, ouvimos. Uma região de riqueza cultural e natural, mas onde, infelizmente, a dignidade do povo ainda é negada. Só unidos podemos transformar essa realidade.
english_translation: Yesterday we began our work journey in the east of the country, passing through Xá-Muteba and Cafunfo, in Lunda-Norte province. We slept in Cafunfo, with the people, and dialogued with various civil society leaders. We shared ideas, but, above all, we listened. A region of cultural and natural wealth, but where, unfortunately, the dignity of the people is still denied. Only united can we transform this reality.

tweet_text: O Presidente Adalberto Costa Júnior foi recebido com grande euforia no município de Xá-Muteba. Militantes, jovens e autoridades tradicionais expressaram seu apoio à sua liderança.
english_translation: President Adalberto Costa Júnior was received with great euphoria in the municipality of Xá-Muteba. Activists, youth, and traditional authorities expressed their support for his leadership.

tweet_text:
A Presidente Nacional da LIMA
(Liga da Mulher Angolana), Cesaltina Kulanda, saúda a Povoação de Kayeye. Mesmo em tempos marcados por crises profundas e uma gestão que falha com o nosso povo, a resiliência e a alegria dos angolanos inspiramnos a lutar por um futuro de justiça e renovação.
english_translation: The National President of LIMA (Angolan Women's League), Cesaltina Kulanda, greets the Village of Kayeye. Even in times marked by deep crises and a management that fails our people, the resilience and joy of Angolans inspire us to fight for a future of justice and renewal.

tweet_text: LUNDA-NORTE|| Ontem, domingo, 2 de março, despedimo-nos dos populares de Cafunfo e seguimos rumo à cidade do Dundo, onde, mesmo chegando às 23h, fomos acolhidos por uma multidão determinada a ouvir nossa mensagem de esperança. Em meio a uma gestão que tem deixado o povo desamparado, trabalhámos em Cuilo, Caungula e em localidades como a vila do Cuando, a povoação de Kayeye e Luzamba. Na Angola Profunda, a voz dos Angolanos ecoa: mesmo diante de crises e políticas equivocadas, o futuro é nosso para construir.
english_translation: LUNDA-NORTE|| Yesterday, Sunday, March 2, we bid farewell to the people of Cafunfo and headed towards the city of Dundo, where, even arriving at 11 PM, we were welcomed by a crowd determined to hear our message of hope. Amidst a management that has left the people helpless, we worked in Cuilo, Caungula, and in localities such as the town of Cuando, the village of Kayeye, and Luzamba. In Deep Angola, the voice of Angolans echoes: even in the face of crises and misguided policies, the future is ours to build.

tweet_text: O dia de ontem foi dedicado ao diálogo com os diferentes estratos da sociedade na cidade do Dundo. Após encontros com autoridades religiosas e tradicionais, realizamos um longo e produtivo debate com a sociedade civil, onde ouvimos as suas maiores preocupações e, juntos, traçamos estratégias para alcançar os próximos objetivos. A mudança constrói-se com participação e compromisso!
english_translation: Yesterday was dedicated to dialogue with different strata of society in the city of Dundo. After meetings with religious and traditional authorities, we held a long and productive debate with civil society, where we listened to their greatest concerns and, together, outlined strategies to achieve the next objectives. Change is built with participation and commitment!

tweet_text: RT  @UNITA_OFICIAL : Hoje 4 de março, Adalberto Costa Júnior trabalha na sede do município  de Lucapa, província da Lunda Norte, onde, a seme…
english_translation: RT @UNITA_OFICIAL: Today, March 4, Adalberto Costa Júnior works at the municipal headquarters of Lucapa, Lunda Norte province, where, to sow...

tweet_text: O Grupo Parlamentar da UNITA chamou auxiliares do Presidente da República para prestarem esclarecimentos na Assembleia Nacional. Até hoje, silêncio total! O que têm a esconder? A prestação de contas não é um favor, é um dever!
english_translation: The UNITA Parliamentary Group called aides to the President of the Republic to provide clarifications in the National Assembly. Until today, total silence! What do they have to hide? Accountability is not a favor, it's a duty!

tweet_text: LUNDA-SUL || Chegamos ontem à Saurimo, dando continuidade ao nosso périplo pela região leste do nosso país. Fomos recebidos com entusiasmo por uma juventude determinada a construir um futuro melhor. Agora, é hora de dialogar e debater os desafios mais urgentes da população.
english_translation: LUNDA-SUL || We arrived yesterday in Saurimo, continuing our journey through the eastern region of our country. We were enthusiastically welcomed by a youth determined to build a better future. Now, it's time to dialogue and debate the most urgent challenges facing the population.

tweet_text: Durante nosso périplo pelo leste de Angola, na Lunda-Sul, visitamos Dom José Manuel Imbamba, arcebispo de Saurimo, e o Governador Provincial, dialogando sobre os desafios do país. Por fim visitamos a família Thumba Kalunga, do Reino Lunda que simboliza o nosso compromisso em honrar as raízes que definem a identidade e o futuro do nosso povo.
english_translation: During our journey through eastern Angola, in Lunda-Sul, we visited Dom José Manuel Imbamba, archbishop of Saurimo, and the Provincial Governor, discussing the country's challenges. Finally, we visited the Thumba Kalunga family, from the Lunda Kingdom, which symbolizes our commitment to honoring the roots that define the identity and future of our people.

Women of Angola, this Women's March we affirm that: - Delaying reforms is acting against women; - Refusing local governments is reducing opportunities for women; it is acting against women; - Denying the Independence of the Judiciary is an attack on women; - Approving laws that enhance the repressive state is an attack on women, because it creates limitations on freedoms, generates mourning, generates suffering, disaggregates homes and women are always the most sacrificed and on whom the consequences fall, without being heard or consulted.

tweet_text: Hoje celebramos a força, a resiliência e a determinação das mulheres que transformam o mundo todos os dias. Que a luta por igualdade e justiça continue a inspirar gerações!
english_translation: Today we celebrate the strength, resilience, and determination of women who transform the world every day. May the fight for equality and justice continue to inspire generations!

tweet_text: A partir do interior de Angola, na Cidade do Luena, província do Moxico - Mulheres, recebam os meus votos de feliz 8 de Março.
english_translation: From the interior of Angola, in the City of Luena, Moxico province - Women, receive my wishes for a happy March 8th.

tweet_text: A esta hora me encuentro retenido en el aeropuerto de Luanda, por el gobierno de Angola, el cual bloquea la entrada de un grupo de políticos africanos invitados por la Fundación Brenthurst @BrenthurstF y la Internacional Demócrata de Centro (IDC-CDI), organización global que presido.
english_translation: At this hour, I am being held at Luanda airport by the government of Angola, which is blocking the entry of a group of African politicians invited by the Brenthurst Foundation @BrenthurstF and the Centrist Democrat International (IDC-CDI), a global organization that I preside over.

tweet_text: Safely back in Addis after being kicked out of Angola. I thank the Kenyan Mission in Luanda led by Amb. Joyce Mmaitsi. You guys are great. However over 20 leaders from various countries are still detained. 9 Tanzanias, 5 from Botswana 3 from Lesotho, 2 Malawians, 1 from eSwatini, 1 German, 2 from the UK and 2 South Africans. The Angolan authorities must immediately let them out . Such a shame that visitors can be treated like this in an African country when Angola chairs the African Union.
english_translation: Safely back in Addis after being kicked out of Angola. I thank the Kenyan Mission in Luanda led by Amb. Joyce Mmaitsi. You guys are great. However over 20 leaders from various countries are still detained. 9 Tanzanias, 5 from Botswana 3 from Lesotho, 2 Malawians, 1 from eSwatini, 1 German, 2 from the UK and 2 South Africans. The Angolan authorities must immediately let them out . Such a shame that visitors can be treated like this in an African country when Angola chairs the African Union.

tweet_text:
AUTOCRACY EXPOSED IN ANGOLA  

I arrived in Angola as part of the Platform for African Democrats, alongside the World Liberty Congress delegation, to participate in a crucial summit on the Future of Democracy in Africa. João Lourenço’s regime responded with repression, harassment, and sabotage to stop our gathering.

  I personally witnessed 12 delegates being deported before even entering the country.
  Former presidents and dignitaries were detained for up to 9 hours without explanation.
  The regime deliberately obstructed our transportation, to prevent us from reaching Benguela.

These are the tactics of dictatorships that fear democracy. The Angolan regime has proven that it does not respect fundamental freedoms and rights.

But let this be clear: We will not be intimidated. The fight for democracy in Angola is the fight for democracy everywhere. No repression will stop our struggle for freedom.

 #Democracy   #Angola   #WorldLibertyCongress   #AfricaDemocrats   https:// t.co/5o0sLitY38
english_translation: AUTOCRACY EXPOSED IN ANGOLA I arrived in Angola as part of the Platform for African Democrats, alongside the World Liberty Congress delegation, to participate in a crucial summit on the Future of Democracy in Africa. João Lourenço’s regime responded with repression, harassment, and sabotage to stop our gathering. I personally witnessed 12 delegates being deported before even entering the country. Former presidents and dignitaries were detained for up to 9 hours without explanation. The regime deliberately obstructed our transportation, to prevent us from reaching Benguela. These are the tactics of dictatorships that fear democracy. The Angolan regime has proven that it does not respect fundamental freedoms and rights. But let this be clear: We will not be intimidated. The fight for democracy in Angola is the fight for democracy everywhere. No repression will stop our struggle for freedom. #Democracy #Angola #WorldLibertyCongress #AfricaDemocrats https://t.co/5o0sLitY38

tweet_text:
AUTORITARISMO EN ANGOLA  

Llegué a Angola como parte de la Plataforma de Demócratas Africanos, junto con la delegación del World Liberty Congress, para participar en una cumbre clave sobre el Futuro de la Democracia en África. El régimen de João Lourenço respondió con represión, hostigamiento y sabotaje para impedir nuestro encuentro.

  Fui testigo directo de la deportación de 12 delegados antes de que pudieran entrar al país.
  Expresidentes y dignatarios fueron detenidos hasta 9 horas sin ninguna explicación.
  El régimen saboteó nuestra movilidad para impedirnos llegar a Benguela.

Estas son las tácticas de las dictaduras que temen la democracia. El régimen de Angola ha demostrado que no respeta las libertades y los derechos fundamentales.

No nos intimidarán. La lucha por la democracia en Angola es la lucha por la democracia en todas partes. Ninguna represión detendrá nuestra lucha por la libertad de todas las autocracias. 

 #Democracia   #Angola   #WorldLibertyCongress   #AfricaDemocrats
english_translation: AUTHORITARIANISM IN ANGOLA I arrived in Angola as part of the Platform of African Democrats, along with the World Liberty Congress delegation, to participate in a key summit on the Future of Democracy in Africa. João Lourenço's regime responded with repression, harassment, and sabotage to prevent our meeting. I directly witnessed the deportation of 12 delegates before they could enter the country. Former presidents and dignitaries were detained for up to 9 hours without any explanation. The regime sabotaged our mobility to prevent us from reaching Benguela. These are the tactics of dictatorships that fear democracy. The Angolan regime has shown that it does not respect fundamental freedoms and rights. We will not be intimidated. The struggle for democracy in Angola is the struggle for democracy everywhere. No repression will stop our fight for freedom from all autocracies. #Democracy #Angola #WorldLibertyCongress #AfricaDemocrats

tweet_text: Tragédia no nosso país: surto de cólera tira duas dezenas de vidas em apenas 24 horas. Até quando a inércia do governo diante das crises de saúde pública?  #Angola
english_translation: Tragedy in our country: cholera outbreak takes two dozen lives in just 24 hours. Until when will the government's inertia continue in the face of public health crises? #Angola

english_translation: MISTREATED | The former President of Botswana, Ian Seretse Khama, describes how he was mistreated by Angolan authorities on March 13 at 4 de Fevereiro International Airport in Luanda.
